definition: according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before

sentences.english: She always does everything by the book.
I did as instructed and put the pill inside the veggie cheese.
sentences.chinese: 我照章办事，将药片混在素食干酪里面。

sentences.english: In those countries, people color inside the lines.
sentences.chinese: 在那些国家里，人们喜欢照章办事。

sentences.english: Persists the principle, handles matters according to rule also is rich in the flexibility.
sentences.chinese: 坚持原则，照章办事而又富于灵活性。

sentences.english: The bank, however, has the option of enforcing the regulation if it considers it necessary.
sentences.chinese: 然而，如果银行认为必要的话，有权照章办理。

sentences.english: We should stick to the principles and be flexible as well.
sentences.chinese: 坚持原则，照章办事而又富于灵活性。

sentences.english: I always go by the book.
Phil: Hey, don't look at me. I just do what I'm told.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，别看我，我只是照章办事。

sentences.english: All these are instances of the integration of principle and flexibility.
sentences.chinese: 坚持原则，照章办事而又富于灵活性。

definition: rules/regulations/constitution/statute/articles of association (of company)/articles of incorporation/charter (of a corporation)/by-laws
old rules/example from the past/former practices
to commandeer/to take over for the state
to do as one thinks fit/to handle by taking circumstances into consideration
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty
